page.title: 05Farming
page.content: Local farmhouses & buildings are a mixture of traditional Hornton stone & bricks. With a large number of springs & the watershed close to the surface the land is heavy & drainage - most recently of the Mole type - is necessary to improve quality. The main crops are arable with wheat & barley predominant. Grass is sown for winter stores of hay & silage. Farm equipment is varied, some very much specialised, & mostly farmer-owned but some contractors go from farm to farm. On the farm the most usual fuel is Diesel Oil for both transport & other machinery including Grain Driers. Dairy cattle with cows averaging between 4000 & 6500 litres of milk per lactation are grazed outside in the summer, inside in the winter & fed on silage with suitable additives year- round for maximum yield.
